title: Earthquake relief efforts under way in Haiti – in pictures | World news
content:
Earthquake relief efforts under way in Haiti – in pictures | World news

Earthquake relief efforts under way in Haiti – in pictures

Shipments of aid from many countries have been arriving in the south-western Tiburon peninsula of Haiti, which was struck by a 7.2 magnitude earthquake on 14 August

Pejman Faratin

Main image: People reach for water during a food distribution in the Picot neighborhood of Les Cayes. Photograph: Matias Delacroix/AP

  • Patients injured during the 7.2 magnitude quake are transported on a US Coast Guard helicopter to Haiti’s capital, Port-au-Prince, from the port town Les Cayes

  • A baby is treated at a hospital in Les Cayes

    Photograph: Xinhua/Rex/Shutterstock

  • A woman and her daughter are treated by a Haitian mobile medical team set up by the Kansas City- based Heart to Heart International in the small village of Melon in south-western Haiti near the epicentre of last week’s earthquake

    Photograph: Robin Loznak/ZUMA Press Wire/Rex/Shutterstock

  • Workers unload food parcels delivered by ships from the Dominican Republic, as tensions rose on Saturday over a lack of aid to remote areas hardest hit by the quake

    Photograph: Reuters

  • A man throws a bag of rice into a crowd of earthquake victims gathered for the distribution of food and water at the 4 Chemins crossroads in Les Cayes

    Photograph: Reginald Louissaint Jr/AFP/Getty Images

  • Haiti’s prime minister says the big challenge now is reconstruction

    Photograph: Orlando Barría/EPA

  • Injured people are taken on stretchers to a plane that will take them to Port-au-Prince, from the airport in Les Cayes

    Photograph: Fernando Llano/AP

  • People reach out for a bag of rice from a relief truck in Vye Terre

    Photograph: Fernando Llano/AP

  • People clamber on to the aid truck in Vye Terre to get supplies

    Photograph: Fernando Llano/AP

  • Police confront the people who tried to climb on to the aid truck

    Photograph: Fernando Llano/AP

  • Rescue workers transfer a survivor to a US army helicopter at the airport in Les Cayes

    Photograph: Matias Delacroix/AP

  • Heavy machines remove the rubble of a collapsed house in Les Cayes

    Photograph: Reuters

  • A 30-tonne shipment of humanitarian aid sent by the government of Spain and several NGOs at the airport in Port-au-Prince

    Photograph: AECID/EPA

  • Members of Mexican rescue team, known as Topos, and Haitian rescue workers search in a collapsed house for a person who might still be alive a week after the quake

    Photograph: Reuters

  • A US army officer arrives at Antoine Simon airport to evaluate the runway for large planes’ landing after a 7.2-magnitude earthquake struck Haiti

    Photograph: Richard Pierrin/Getty Images

  • People reach for water during food distribution in the Picot neighbourhood of Les Cayes

    Photograph: Matias Delacroix/AP

Earthquake relief efforts under way in Haiti – in pictures 

    
            










            
                
                    
Shipments of aid from many countries have been arriving in the south-western Tiburon peninsula of Haiti, which was struck by a 7.2 magnitude earthquake on 14 August

                
            

            
                
                    

    Pejman Faratin

                            People reach for water during a food distribution in the Picot neighborhood of Les Cayes.
